comment: He was a few in the MSCS program at KSU, that wanted to help the student succeed. Unfortunately he has left KSU.
Dr. Aledhari is a great professor, I had a good experience in the course. The course curriculum is easy in which he had explained in detail with assignments and as well as project.

Did a project - Directed Studies with with Dr. Aledhari in Summer.  Its quite complex project and however was able to complete the critical & major part of it with lots of support from Prof.  He took few extra classes out of his busy schedule to support the completion.  He is Great guide & Mentor with lots of knowledge.  He is under rated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: he is really encouraging and very good professor.

I took his CS 7267 - Machine Learning online class. Dr. Aledhari is polite, helpful, and always helps students. His assignments are very easy. You're supposed to write the missing lines. You will get the quiz questions from the discussed slides.

He grades as per the rubrics, and all most majority of the students have received "A" grade this sem.

He is one who inspired students to work hard to be in good position.and encourage in every situation if we fails though he will support to gain knowledge.  He will be with us in course work as well as project support. if we have interest in Work he will connect constantly to get good knowledge for students.

Dr. Aledhari is one of the best! Fantastic teacher. Very responsive. Willing to help you if you put in the work. Option of taking exams or writing a term paper. I did the paper and it was a great experience. This is a professor that wants to see his students succeed.

He will definitely make you study, At the same time highly accessible to guide and help complete the class project and report. Easy grader, gave bonus credits in both exams.  I took another class of him in summer 2022..

Professor Aledhari is a good orator first than a teacher , he narrates every topic in his lecture by giving a realtime example to make us better understand all the ML algorithms. He has a fair and transparent grading policy showing 0 bias, for example i was a research assistant under him but i got B which shows his unbiased grading which is good.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Took ML at Grad Level & Dr. Aledhari is the best prof, (he is All-in-one) as he make you learn subject, spend time give individual attention, student friendly, highly positive attitude.  Apart from actual subject, learnt new skill of analyzing & writing research papers. Provide career guidance & support. For sure take his courses in future.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: His course is awesome and helped me understand and explore the ML concepts better and the project helped explore various ML models. The course is research-oriented and the instructions for every submission is clearly stated and lets you think like a researcher. If you are ready to learn learn ML and do research then I recommend taking his course.

Professor Aledhari takes the time to explain the concepts and the expectations. Professor Aledhari is also eager to help clarify misunderstanding and always willing to help no matter the hour or time. Professor Aledhari emphasizes on the importance to getting the knowledge and greatly participates in transmitting knowledge to students.

This course is research-oriented and I have opted for research in AI. The course structure is goal-oriented, at the end of the semester we need to publish an article based on our research work. Dr. Aledhari provides good support & feedback and gives the motivation to complete the task. Ask more questions to get a clear idea of the task. It helps!!

I took his Machine Vision class in Fall 2021. He is a very good professor who gives correct feedback for improvising the project work. I completed  my best Masters project work under the supervision of Dr.Aledhari who provided template for each project stage and gave constant feedback and resources to achieve the results. Hats off to Professor.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Aledhari is one of the most versatile, respectful, and student-friendly professors. He takes care of each individual in the class & actively responds the emails. He provides timely feedback on assignments & tests and makes the students work on applying the skills (in project work) rather than just learning. I am glad to be part of his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Stressful course centered around a *very academic* research paper. Ugh. Lectures were too in-depth, hard to follow, and frankly not interesting. Tests covered only a fraction of the material. He's very, very particular about how he wants things done. He was generous with grades in the end, and he really seems to mean well, but I was not a fan.
You will learn a lot but it is not worth that much work. He grades very toughly and his classes are not productive at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Pros: Cares a ton about the class, super accessible outside of class, very approachable, You will learn a LOT. Cons: INCREDIBLY hard. I probably spend 3 times as much time on this class than all my other classes combined. He is also a very hard grader. You will have to study hard. If you put the time in, you will get alot out of the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I'll admit, yes his lectures are boring. However, he does respond to emails and will try to help if you are having trouble . His class is more research-heavy since there is a group project and a research paper. While he can be vague at times, he is knowledgeable about the material and is willing to help his students. He also curves on tests
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Worst prof ever stay away. Actually loves wasting your time. Makes it seem so easy in the beginning. Avoid him!! Too many papers and stupid assignments.

such a pointless class. topic is very interesting but his lectures do a poor job of displaying that. pointless essays and hw is interesting but he only asks you to write 3 lines and he does the rest. i rather code than research!! im writing this cause there were no reviews when i looked him up. Dont make the same mistake i did.

Seriously one of the most confusing professors I've ever taken, the class was beyond pointless and I feel like learned nothing. He may sound nice and helpful at first but don't be fooled. His feedback is vague, his rubrics are absolute to specific, he grades on things he didn't ask for, and he doesn't answer emails. He also has a temper. Stay away
Worst teacher ever. so boring lectures sucked and test were based off of it. information was kinda interesting but he was not. too much work for an elective. id stay away
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Do not take this professor. His lectures are boring and useless, they basically teach you nothing but his test are based on the vague lectures. He gives programming assignments that have nothing to do with the class and LONG papers. His feedback is also terrible. He expects graduate/professor level work from undergrads, save yourself the stress!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: STAY AWAY. STAY AWAY. STAY AWAY. you do not want to take this guy. worst teacher ever. actually horrible. Cant lecture but makes all his tests off lectures. Boring heavy accent and expects above graduate level effort from you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Extremely boring class, you learn nothing and put an unnecessary amount of work in to basically learn nothing. Tests are based off of those absurdly boring lectures that you have to go but are impossible to listen to. Not only that you most likely will write atleast 12 pages of pointless papers and 4 lines of actual coding all semester. AVOID HIM

Would avoid this guy at all costs. Never take him unless there a literally no professors left and you NEED to graduate. Imagine taking a CS class where all you do is write papers and do pointless assignments and then getting hit with even more assignments and pointless things and you might be approaching the level of time wasted for this class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Do not take him makes you work hard for no reason. most pointless class ever. Attendance is mandatory and you have to go an listen to the most dry lectures ever. Work load is mainly writing like 40+ pages the semester and then like 4 programming assignments that don't teach you anything. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Do not take absolute worst teacher out there. Don't fall for him being nice and making it seem like its impossible to fail when he goes over the syllabus. If you take him (WHICH YOU SHOULDNT EVER) expect to do more work then youve done in all your classes at Kennesaw combined. And its not programming work its the dumbest ,most pointless writing.
He is a very responsible teacher and often encourages us. Responsible for every task and assignment, with clear criteria. I would love to take his class again, which is very helpful for my study.

Dr. Aledhari is one of the most understanding professors I've had. He knows his stuff and clearly cares for students. He is willing to work with you in case you need extensions or are missing assignments. His tests are a nightmare but they aren't worth that much compared to the project. For the project be sure you get good members.

This course made us work 3times than the other courses. Don't fall for his sweet words. I didn't lose any point until the final, final exam was of 10%, even if you get 0 you can easily get an A. But he graded B or C in such cases. He gives grades on face value, verbally insults in class. No clear explanation of why you got B/C/D or F. Hilarious
